intro: Poa subspicata var. subspicata, commonly known as slender meadowgrass, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and forest edges. Its inflorescence consists of a loose to dense panicle, bearing small, spikelet-like flowers. This variety is characterized by its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in moderate to dry conditions.
